events.title: Allied Invasion of Sicily
events.description: Operation Husky begins the Allied invasion of Sicily, the first step in the Italian Campaign.
events.significance: Opened the Mediterranean to Allied shipping and began the conquest of Italy.

events.title: Italy Surrenders
events.description: Italy signs an armistice with the Allies. German forces immediately occupy the peninsula.
events.significance: Italy's surrender complicated rather than simplified the campaign, as Germany took control.

events.title: Salerno Landing (Operation Avalanche)
events.description: Allied forces land at Salerno, south of Naples. Germans mount fierce counterattacks.
events.significance: The 985th landed at Salerno as part of this operation.

events.title: Naples Liberated
events.description: Allied forces enter Naples after German demolitions devastate the city's port and infrastructure.
events.significance: Naples became the major supply port for the Italian Campaign.

events.title: Winter Line Fighting Begins
events.description: Allies encounter German Winter Line defenses in the mountains south of Rome.
events.significance: Began the grueling winter campaign that would last until spring 1944.

events.title: Battle of San Pietro
events.description: Fierce fighting for the village of San Pietro Infine blocks the approach to the Liri Valley.
events.significance: Costly battle captured in John Huston's famous documentary.

events.title: First Battle of Monte Cassino
events.description: First major assault on the Gustav Line at Monte Cassino begins. American forces suffer heavy casualties.
events.significance: Began four months of bitter fighting for the monastery hill.

events.title: Anzio Landing
events.description: Allied forces land at Anzio, behind the Gustav Line, but fail to break out.
events.significance: Intended to outflank Cassino, the landing became a months-long siege.

events.title: Monte Cassino Abbey Destroyed
events.description: Allied bombers destroy the historic Benedictine monastery atop Monte Cassino.
events.significance: Controversial decision that failed to dislodge German defenders.

events.title: Third Battle of Monte Cassino
events.description: Massive aerial and artillery bombardment followed by New Zealand and Indian assault on Cassino town.
events.significance: Despite destroying the town, Allies failed to take the position.

events.title: Operation Diadem
events.description: Final Allied offensive to break the Gustav Line. Massive multinational assault along entire front.
events.significance: The breakthrough that finally ended the Cassino stalemate.

events.title: Monte Cassino Falls
events.description: Polish forces capture the ruins of Monte Cassino after four months of Allied assaults.
events.significance: Opened the road to Rome after one of the war's most costly battles.

events.title: Anzio Breakout
events.description: Forces at Anzio finally break out and link up with the main Allied advance.
events.significance: Ended the four-month siege at Anzio beachhead.

events.title: Liberation of Rome
events.description: Allied forces enter Rome, the first Axis capital to fall. Germans retreat northward.
events.significance: Major propaganda victory, though overshadowed by D-Day two days later.

events.title: D-Day: Normandy Invasion
events.description: Operation Overlord begins with Allied landings in Normandy, France.
events.significance: Opened the Western Front; shifted strategic focus away from Italy.

events.title: Florence Liberated
events.description: Allied forces enter Florence as Germans retreat to the Gothic Line.
events.significance: Cultural treasures preserved as Germans spared the historic center.

events.title: Paris Liberated
events.description: French and American forces liberate Paris after four years of German occupation.
events.significance: Major milestone in the liberation of Western Europe.

events.title: Gothic Line Assault Begins
events.description: Allies attack the Gothic Line, Germany's last major defensive line in Italy.
events.significance: Began the final phase of the Italian Campaign.

events.title: Battle of the Bulge
events.description: German counteroffensive in the Ardennes catches Allies by surprise.
events.significance: Last major German offensive of the war diverted resources from Italy.

events.title: Yalta Conference
events.description: Roosevelt, Churchill, and Stalin meet to plan the postwar world.
events.significance: Shaped the post-war order in Europe.

events.title: Spring Offensive in Italy
events.description: Final Allied offensive in Italy begins, breaking through Gothic Line remnants.
events.significance: Led to the complete collapse of German forces in Italy.

events.title: President Roosevelt Dies
events.description: Franklin D. Roosevelt dies at Warm Springs, Georgia. Harry Truman becomes President.
events.significance: Loss of wartime leader just weeks before victory in Europe.

events.title: Bologna Liberated
events.description: Polish and Italian forces liberate Bologna as German resistance collapses in northern Italy.
events.significance: Opened the Po Valley to rapid Allied advance.

events.title: Mussolini Executed
events.description: Italian dictator Benito Mussolini captured and executed by Italian partisans.
events.significance: End of Fascism in Italy.

events.title: Hitler Dies
events.description: Adolf Hitler commits suicide in his Berlin bunker as Soviet forces close in.
events.significance: End of Nazi leadership.

events.title: German Forces Surrender in Italy
events.description: All German forces in Italy surrender unconditionally to the Allies.
events.significance: End of combat operations for the 985th after 510 days of combat.

events.title: V-E Day
events.description: Victory in Europe Day marks the unconditional surrender of Nazi Germany.
events.significance: End of the war in Europe; celebrations worldwide.

events.title: V-J Day
events.description: Japan announces surrender following atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki.
events.significance: End of World War II.
